title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 53.2 - Definitions
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 53.2 - Definitions

State Regulations
(a) Brake lining. That portion of a motor vehicle braking device which produces friction when
pressed against another harder or longer lasting portion of the braking
device. (b) Classification. A
category, consisting of and determined by "normal" and "hot" coefficients of
friction as set forth in section
53.4
of this Part into which a
brake lining or formulation falls and under which an approval is
issued. (c) Formulation. A
specified mixture of materials from which brake linings are made and the
corresponding sequence of production processing which together determine the
characteristics of the brake lining. (d) Manufacturer. (1)
A person who makes a brake lining, or
(2)
A person who distributes or
sells a brake lining made by another manufacturer providing such brake lining
is sold or distributed by such person under a name different from that under
which the brake lining is sold or distributed by the maker and provided that
such person submits such brake lining for approval under his own name as
manufacturer. (e) Sale; distribution. Such terms shall have the ordinary meanings ascribed to them
except that the transfer of a brake lining from a person who makes a brake
lining to a person who is a manufacturer as defined in paragraph (2) of
subdivision (d) of this section shall not be considered a sale or a
distribution. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15
ยง
53.2

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
